channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: As Gaza starves, the next generation may also endure the consequences
item.description: U.N. officials say many people in Gaza are experiencing "famine-like conditions." Health experts who have studied past famines warn that the fallout c...

item.title: DHS is urging DACA recipients to self-deport
item.description: "DACA does not confer any form of legal status in this country," said DHS assistant press secretary Tricia McLaughlin, who then encouraged "every pers...

item.title: Trump lawsuit against Murdoch and 'Wall Street Journal' turns personal
item.description: Trump says he personally told his "very good friend Rupert Murdoch" that he had not sent a racy birthday greeting two decades ago to Jeffrey Epstein. ...

item.title: Hall of Fame second baseman Ryne Sandberg has died after battling cancer
item.description: Ryne Sandberg, a Hall of Fame second baseman who became one of baseball's best all-around players while starring for the Chicago Cubs, has died. He wa...

item.title: Shooter opens fire outside Reno casino, killing 3 and injuring several others
item.description: A gunman opened fire Monday outside the largest casino in Reno, Nevada, killing three people and wounding three others before police shot the suspect ...

item.title: There was no "missing minute" in Epstein jail video, government source says
item.description: FBI officials promised raw, unaltered video to quell speculation about Epstein's suicide.

item.title: Beijing floods kill 30 as China sees summer of extreme weather
item.description: President Xi Jinping called for "all-out" rescue efforts and preparation for "worst-case" scenarios.

item.title: Thailand accuses Cambodia of violating hours-old ceasefire
item.description: Cambodia says there have been "no armed clashes" between the two sides since the midnight ceasefire.

item.title: Police officer among four dead in shooting at New York City office building
item.description: Authorities say Shane Devon Tamura travelled across the country from Las Vegas to open fire inside the skyscraper.

item.title: Trump wraps up golf-filled Scotland visit by opening new golf course
item.description: President Trump opened a new golf course bearing his name in Scotland on Tuesday, capping a five-day foreign trip designed around playing golf and agr...

item.title: Russian strikes kill some 22 in Ukraine as Moscow stays defiant vs. Trump deadline
item.description: A Russian airstrike on a prison in southeastern Ukraine killed at least 17 inmates and wounded more than 80 others, officials said.

item.title: Russia strikes prison in Ukraine, killing 17 and wounding dozens
item.description: The attack is one of many on the frontline region of Zaporizhzhia as Trump renews demands for a ceasefire.

item.title: Nigeria kidnappers kill 35 hostages even after ransom paid
item.description: They were put to death despite ransoms being paid for their release, a local official told the BBC.

item.title: 7/28: The Takeout with Major Garrett
item.description: President Trump touts trade agreement with European Union; E.U. to purchase $750B of U.S. energy under new trade deal

item.title: Krill catch in Antarctica soars to record following collapse of conservation deal
NYPD officer, 3 people killed by gunman in Midtown Manhattan
item.description: A New York City police officer and three other people were killed in a shooting in Midtown Manhattan on Monday evening, police confirmed at a late-nig...

item.title: A shooting at a midtown Manhattan office building, in photos
Gunman kills 4, including police officer, in shooting at New York City office tower
